Our policy is to consider all DMCA abuse reports and take appropriate action.
</p>

<h2>How to Write a Proper DMCA Notice</h2>

<p>
A DMCA notice will notify us of particular facts in a document signed under penalty of perjury. To write a DMCA notice, please provide the following information:
</p>

<ul class="nobullet nopadding">
<li>
Identify yourself as either:
The owner of a copyrighted work(s), or A person "authorized to act on behalf of the owner of an exclusive right that is allegedly infringed."
</li>
<li>
State your contact information, including your TRUE NAME, street address, telephone number, and email address.
</li>
<li>
Identify the copyrighted work that you believe is being infringed, or if a large number of works are appearing at a single website, a representative list of the works.
</li>
<li>
Identify the material that you claim is infringing your copyrighted work, to which you are requesting that us disable access over the World Wide Web.
</li>
<li>
Identify the location of the material on the World Wide Web by providing "information reasonably sufficient to permit us to locate the material."
</li>
<li>
State that you have "a good faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owner, its agents, or the law."
</li>
<li>
State that the information in the notice is accurate, under penalty of perjury.
</li>
<li>
Sign the notice with an electronic signature and email it to admin@thisdomain.com.
</li>
</ul>

<p>
If you have any other questions, you can <a href="/contact">contact us</a>.
</p>
